subtitle: How do I make her stop?
description: How do I make her stop?
title: newDAD: Cry Baby Cry
content:
Brought to you by MAMA Before my baby was born, the one thing I knew for sure
was that I made babies cry. How many times had an aunt or cousin put their
baby into my arms and the baby had cried? It was as if the baby knew I was not
meant to be a father! So just before mine came, I wondered: what if my baby
does the same thing? I decided I never wanted this to happen. So I made a
point of finding out exactly why babies cry. I asked all my expert aunts! This
is what they say: there are four reasons for a crying baby. It’s hungry, it’s
in pain, it’s got a wet nappy, or it’s tired. But can’t babies also just cry
because they are sad? They can definitely be happy for no reason. The moment
my daughter gave me a real smile for the first time she was around 6 weeks
old. It was my best moment! It was as if she had just become a real human
being. Babies smile at their mothers and fathers and other people they
recognise. Then they grin and chuckle, gurgle and giggle. Now I seem to spend
a lot of time doing funny things just to make my girl laugh – I pull silly
faces, make animal noises, jump around like a frog, pull her toes. When she
cries I do the 4-point check. I first make sure she’s well fed, has a dry
nappy, had a good night’s sleep and doesn’t have a thorn down her pants. When
I’m sure she’s okay, then I work on cheering her up for real. I know some
great songs. I can dance for her, read a story, tickle her feet… **MAMA HELP:
A crying baby can cause a parent a lot of stress. First run through newDAD’s
4-point checklist to make sure your baby’s comfortable. Once you’re sure she
is, it may be time to bring out the singing and the dancing!**
